explains: v. 削弱（cripple的ing形式）；使受损
n. 残缺的东西；有缺陷的事物

sentences.en: He was stricken at twenty-one with a crippling malady.
sentences.cn: 二十一岁时腿瘸疾病让他受到重击。

sentences.en: Arthritis and rheumatism are prominent crippling diseases.
sentences.cn: 关节炎和风湿病是常见致残的疾病。

sentences.en: The high cost of capital has a crippling effect on many small firms.
sentences.cn: 高资本成本对许多小公司有着极坏的影响。
